metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29991 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Firefox incorrectly accepted a newline in a HTTP/3 header, interpretting itas two separate headers. This allowed for a header splitting attack againstservers using HTTP/3. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 91.0.1 andThunderbird < 91.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
